events.title: Memory Impairment
events.description: The patient has been diagnosed with memory impairment, which is a significant concern in the context of their overall mental health. This condition may indicate the early stages of cognitive decline or dementia, necessitating ongoing monitoring and management. The patient is currently stable and has a mental health care plan in place.

events.title: Diabetic Foot Risk Assessment
events.description: The patient has been assessed with moderate risk for diabetic foot complications, with both the left and right feet showing signs of risk. The assessment included absent pulses in the posterior tibial and dorsalis pedis arteries, and abnormal monofilament sensation in both feet. This indicates a need for careful management and regular follow-up to prevent potential complications.

events.title: Urine Test Results
events.description: The patient underwent a urine test that revealed significant abnormalities, including a positive result for leucocytes and nitrites, indicating a possible urinary tract infection. The urine was also noted to be cloudy, which further supports this diagnosis. These findings require prompt treatment to address the infection and prevent further complications.

events.title: Body Mass Index Concerns
events.description: The patient's body mass index (BMI) was recorded at 13.96 kg/m², which is significantly below the normal range and indicates severe underweight status. This condition poses serious health risks and necessitates immediate intervention, including nutritional support and a weight management program.
